text: Ondřej Pukl (died 9 February 1936) was a Bohemian track and field athlete who competed at the 1900 Summer Olympics in Paris, France. Pukl competed in the 800 metres. He placed fourth or fifth in his first-round (semifinals) heat and did not advance to the final. In the 1500 metres, Pukl finished somewhere in the bottom third of the nine-man, single-round race. ==References== * De Wael, Herman. Herman's Full Olympians: "Athletics 1900". Accessed 18 March 2006.
